definition_en: To put a decision, plan, or agreement into effect.
definition_pt: Colocar uma decisão, plano ou acordo em efeito.
example: The new policy will be implemented next month.

definition_en: To strongly suggest the truth or existence of something not expressly stated.
definition_pt: Sugerir fortemente a verdade ou existência de algo não expressamente declarado.
example: Are you implying that I lied?

definition_en: To force something to be accepted or put in place.
definition_pt: Forçar algo a ser aceito ou colocado em prática.
example: The government imposed a curfew during the emergency.

definition_en: A thing that motivates or encourages someone to do something.
definition_pt: Uma coisa que motiva ou encoraja alguém a fazer algo.
example: Tax incentives are offered to companies that create jobs.

definition_en: The occurrence, rate, or frequency of a disease, crime, or other undesirable thing.
definition_pt: A ocorrência, taxa ou frequência de uma doença, crime ou outra coisa indesejável.
example: There's a high incidence of diabetes in this population.

definition_en: Money received, especially on a regular basis, for work or through investments.
definition_pt: Dinheiro recebido, especialmente regularmente, por trabalho ou através de investimentos.
example: The family has a modest income.

definition_en: To take in or contain something as part of a whole; to include.
definition_pt: Receber ou conter algo como parte de um todo; incluir.
example: We've incorporated your suggestions into the plan.

definition_en: An alphabetical list of names, subjects, etc., with references to the places where they occur; to record in such a list.
definition_pt: Uma lista alfabética de nomes, assuntos, etc., com referências aos lugares onde ocorrem; registrar em tal lista.
example: Look it up in the index at the back of the book.

definition_en: A single human being as distinct from a group; of or for a particular person.
definition_pt: Um único ser humano distinto de um grupo; de ou para uma pessoa específica.
example: The rights of the individual are protected by law.

definition_en: To deduce or conclude information from evidence and reasoning rather than from explicit statements.
definition_pt: Deduzir ou concluir informações a partir de evidências e raciocínio, em vez de declarações explícitas.
example: From his tone, I inferred that he was unhappy.

definition_en: The basic physical and organizational structures and facilities needed for the operation of a society or enterprise.
definition_pt: As estruturas e instalações físicas e organizacionais básicas necessárias para a operação de uma sociedade ou empresa.
example: The country needs to invest in its infrastructure.

definition_en: To hinder, restrain, or prevent an action or process.
definition_pt: Dificultar, restringir ou impedir uma ação ou processo.
example: Fear can inhibit people from taking risks.

definition_en: Existing or occurring at the beginning.
definition_pt: Existente ou ocorrendo no início.
example: My initial reaction was one of surprise.

definition_en: To cause a process or action to begin.
definition_pt: Causar o início de um processo ou ação.
example: They initiated legal proceedings against the company.

definition_en: To introduce a substance into something with a syringe; to introduce something new.
definition_pt: Introduzir uma substância em algo com uma seringa; introduzir algo novo.
example: The doctor will inject the vaccine. / They injected new capital into the business.

definition_en: To make changes in something established, especially by introducing new methods, ideas, or products.
definition_pt: Fazer mudanças em algo estabelecido, especialmente introduzindo novos métodos, ideias ou produtos.
example: The company continues to innovate in the technology sector.

definition_en: What is put in, taken in, or operated on by any process or system; a contribution of information.
definition_pt: O que é colocado, absorvido ou operado por qualquer processo ou sistema; uma contribuição de informação.
example: I'd appreciate your input on this matter.

definition_en: To place, fit, or thrust something into another thing.
definition_pt: Colocar, encaixar ou enfiar algo em outra coisa.
example: Insert the coin into the slot.

definition_en: To look at someone or something closely, typically to assess their condition or to discover any shortcomings.
definition_pt: Olhar para alguém ou algo de perto, normalmente para avaliar sua condição ou descobrir quaisquer deficiências.
example: Health officials came to inspect the restaurant.

definition_en: An example or single occurrence of something.
definition_pt: Um exemplo ou ocorrência única de algo.
example: In this instance, I think we should be cautious.

definition_en: An organization having a particular purpose, especially one that is involved with science, education, or a specific profession.
definition_pt: Uma organização com um propósito específico, especialmente uma envolvida com ciência, educação ou uma profissão específica.
example: She works at a research institute.

definition_en: To direct or command someone to do something; to teach someone a subject or skill.
definition_pt: Dirigir ou comandar alguém a fazer algo; ensinar alguém um assunto ou habilidade.
example: The judge instructed the jury to ignore the comment.

definition_en: To combine one thing with another so that they become a whole; to bring into equal participation in society.
definition_pt: Combinar uma coisa com outra para que se tornem um todo; trazer para participação igualitária na sociedade.
example: We need to integrate these new findings into our theory.

definition_en: The quality of being honest and having strong moral principles; the state of being whole and undivided.
definition_pt: A qualidade de ser honesto e ter fortes princípios morais; o estado de ser inteiro e indiviso.
example: No one doubts his personal integrity.

definition_en: The ability to acquire and apply knowledge and skills; information of military or political value.
definition_pt: A capacidade de adquirir e aplicar conhecimentos e habilidades; informações de valor militar ou político.
example: He's a person of considerable intelligence.

definition_en: Of extreme force, degree, or strength; having or showing strong feelings or opinions.
definition_pt: De força, grau ou intensidade extremos; ter ou mostrar sentimentos ou opiniões fortes.
example: The heat was intense. / She has an intense personality.

definition_en: To act in such a way as to have an effect on another; to communicate or be involved directly.
definition_pt: Agir de forma a ter efeito sobre outro; comunicar-se ou envolver-se diretamente.
example: The teacher encourages children to interact with each other.

definition_en: Coming between two things in time, place, order, character, etc.
definition_pt: Vindo entre duas coisas no tempo, lugar, ordem, caráter, etc.
example: This is an intermediate level course.

definition_en: Of or situated on the inside; relating to the domestic affairs of a country.
definition_pt: De ou situado no interior; relacionado aos assuntos domésticos de um país.
example: The company is conducting an internal investigation.

definition_en: To explain the meaning of information or actions; to translate orally.
definition_pt: Explicar o significado de informações ou ações; traduzir oralmente.
example: How do you interpret these results?

definition_en: An intervening time or space; a pause or break in activity.
definition_pt: Um tempo ou espaço interveniente; uma pausa ou intervalo na atividade.
example: There will be a 15-minute interval between acts.

definition_en: To come between so as to prevent or alter a result or course of events.
definition_pt: Vir entre para prevenir ou alterar um resultado ou curso de eventos.
example: The government refused to intervene in the dispute.

definition_en: Belonging naturally; essential.
definition_pt: Pertencente naturalmente; essencial.
example: The intrinsic value of these paintings goes beyond their market price.

definition_en: To carry out a systematic or formal inquiry to discover and examine the facts of an incident, allegation, etc.
definition_pt: Realizar uma investigação sistemática ou formal para descobrir e examinar os fatos de um incidente, alegação, etc.
example: Police are investigating the robbery.

definition_en: To cite or appeal to someone or something as an authority for an action; to call on a deity or spirit.
definition_pt: Citar ou apelar para alguém ou algo como uma autoridade para uma ação; chamar uma divindade ou espírito.
example: He invoked his right to remain silent.

definition_en: To cause a person, place, or thing to be or remain alone or apart from others.
definition_pt: Fazer uma pessoa, lugar ou coisa ficar ou permanecer sozinha ou separada dos outros.
example: Patients with the disease must be isolated.

definition_en: A paid position of regular employment; a task or piece of work.
definition_pt: Uma posição remunerada de emprego regular; uma tarefa ou pedaço de trabalho.
example: She got a new job in marketing.

definition_en: A newspaper or magazine that deals with a particular subject or professional activity; a daily record of news and events.
definition_pt: Um jornal ou revista que trata de um assunto específico ou atividade profissional; um registro diário de notícias e eventos.
example: She keeps a personal journal. / It was published in a scientific journal.

definition_en: To show or prove to be right or reasonable.
definition_pt: Mostrar ou provar ser certo ou razoável.
example: How can you justify such behavior?

definition_en: A small piece of paper, fabric, etc., attached to an object and giving information about it; to attach such a piece.
definition_pt: Um pequeno pedaço de papel, tecido, etc., preso a um objeto e fornecendo informações sobre ele; anexar tal pedaço.
example: Read the label before taking the medicine.

definition_en: Work, especially hard physical work; the body of workers in a country or industry.
definition_pt: Trabalho, especialmente trabalho físico duro; o corpo de trabalhadores em um país ou indústria.
example: The project required months of hard labor.

definition_en: A sheet, quantity, or thickness of material, typically one of several, covering a surface or body.
definition_pt: Uma folha, quantidade ou espessura de material, normalmente uma de várias, cobrindo uma superfície ou corpo.
example: The cake has multiple layers of cream and fruit.

definition_en: An educational talk to an audience, especially one of students in a university; to give such a talk.
definition_pt: Uma palestra educativa para um público, especialmente um de estudantes em uma universidade; dar tal palestra.
example: Professor Smith gives excellent lectures on medieval history.

definition_en: Relating to the law; permitted by law.
definition_pt: Relacionado à lei; permitido por lei.
example: We need to get legal advice before proceeding.

definition_en: To make or enact laws.
definition_pt: Fazer ou promulgar leis.
example: The government plans to legislate on this issue.

definition_en: To impose a tax, fee, or fine; an amount of money charged as a tax.
definition_pt: Impor um imposto, taxa ou multa; uma quantia de dinheiro cobrada como imposto.
example: The city levies a tax on hotel rooms.

definition_en: Open to new behavior or opinions and willing to discard traditional values; relating to a political philosophy based on individual rights.
definition_pt: Aberto a novos comportamentos ou opiniões e disposto a descartar valores tradicionais; relacionado a uma filosofia política baseada em direitos individuais.
example: He has very liberal views on social issues.

definition_en: A permit from an authority to own or use something, do a particular thing, or carry on a trade; to grant such a permit.
definition_pt: Uma permissão de uma autoridade para possuir ou usar algo, fazer uma coisa específica ou exercer um comércio; conceder tal permissão.
example: You need a license to drive a car.

definition_en: In the same way; also.
definition_pt: Da mesma maneira; também.
example: It was a great trip. Likewise, the food was excellent.

definition_en: A relationship between two things or situations; to make a connection between.
definition_pt: Um relacionamento entre duas coisas ou situações; fazer uma conexão entre.
example: There appears to be a link between the two crimes.

definition_en: To discover the exact place or position of something.
definition_pt: Descobrir o local ou posição exata de algo.
example: Can you locate the source of the noise?

definition_en: To handle or control a tool or device skillfully; to control or influence a person or situation cleverly or unscrupulously.
definition_pt: Manusear ou controlar uma ferramenta ou dispositivo com habilidade; controlar ou influenciar uma pessoa ou situação de forma inteligente ou inescrupulosa.
example: He manipulated the data to support his theory.

definition_en: Relating to or done with the hands; a book of instructions.
definition_pt: Relacionado ou feito com as mãos; um livro de instruções.
example: The work requires manual dexterity. / Read the instruction manual first.

definition_en: The edge or border of something; an amount by which something is won.
definition_pt: A borda ou limite de algo; uma quantia pela qual algo é ganho.
example: He won by a narrow margin.

definition_en: Fully developed physically; having reached an advanced stage of mental or emotional development.
definition_pt: Totalmente desenvolvido fisicamente; tendo atingido um estágio avançado de desenvolvimento mental ou emocional.
example: She's very mature for her age.

definition_en: To make as large or great as possible.
definition_pt: Tornar tão grande ou o maior possível.
example: We need to maximize our efficiency.

definition_en: A system of parts working together in a machine; a natural or established process by which something takes place.
definition_pt: Um sistema de partes trabalhando juntas em uma máquina; um processo natural ou estabelecido pelo qual algo acontece.
example: The watch has a complex mechanism.

definition_en: The main means of mass communication, such as broadcasting, publishing, and the internet.
definition_pt: Os principais meios de comunicação de massa, como transmissão, publicação e internet.
example: The event received widespread media coverage.

definition_en: Relating to the science or practice of medicine.
definition_pt: Relacionado à ciência ou prática da medicina.
example: He requires medical attention.

definition_en: An agency or means of doing something; the intervening substance through which impressions are conveyed.
definition_pt: Uma agência ou meio de fazer algo; a substância interveniente através da qual as impressões são transmitidas.
example: Watercolor is his preferred medium. / Television is a powerful medium.

definition_en: Relating to the mind.
definition_pt: Relacionado à mente.
example: He's suffering from mental exhaustion.

definition_en: To move from one region or habitat to another, especially regularly according to the seasons.
definition_pt: Mover-se de uma região ou habitat para outro, especialmente regularmente de acordo com as estações.
example: Many birds migrate south for the winter.

definition_en: Relating to or characteristic of soldiers or armed forces.
definition_pt: Relacionado ou característico de soldados ou forças armadas.
example: The country has a strong military tradition.

definition_en: Of a minimum amount, quantity, or degree; negligible.
definition_pt: De uma quantidade, quantidade ou grau mínimo; insignificante.
example: The damage was minimal.

definition_en: To reduce something to the smallest possible amount or degree.
definition_pt: Reduzir algo à menor quantidade ou grau possível.
example: We need to minimize the risks.

definition_en: The least or smallest amount or quantity possible, attainable, or required.
definition_pt: A menor ou menor quantidade ou quantidade possível, atingível ou necessária.
example: We need a minimum of ten people to run the course.

definition_en: A government department headed by a minister.
definition_pt: Um departamento governamental chefiado por um ministro.
example: She works at the Ministry of Education.

definition_en: Lesser in importance, seriousness, or significance.
definition_pt: Menor em importância, seriedade ou significância.
example: It's just a minor problem.

definition_en: A way or manner in which something occurs or is experienced, expressed, or done.
definition_pt: Uma maneira ou forma pela qual algo ocorre ou é experimentado, expresso ou feito.
example: The camera has an automatic mode.

definition_en: To make partial or minor changes to something.
definition_pt: Fazer alterações parciais ou menores em algo.
example: The design was modified to improve safety.

definition_en: A reason for doing something, especially one that is hidden or not obvious.
definition_pt: Uma razão para fazer algo, especialmente uma que está oculta ou não óbvia.
example: The police are trying to establish a motive for the murder.

definition_en: Experienced or done by each of two or more parties towards the other or others.
definition_pt: Experienciado ou feito por cada uma de duas ou mais partes em relação à outra ou outras.
example: The feeling was mutual.

definition_en: To nullify; to make ineffective.
definition_pt: Anular; tornar ineficaz.
example: These facts negate your theory.

definition_en: A group or system of interconnected people or things; to interact with others to exchange information.
definition_pt: Um grupo ou sistema de pessoas ou coisas interconectadas; interagir com outros para trocar informações.
example: She has a wide network of contacts. / It's important to network at these events.

definition_en: Not supporting or helping either side in a conflict, disagreement, etc.; impartial.
definition_pt: Não apoiar ou ajudar nenhum dos lados em um conflito, desacordo, etc.; imparcial.
example: Switzerland remained neutral during the war.

definition_en: In spite of that; nevertheless.
definition_pt: Apesar disso; no entanto.
example: It was raining heavily. Nonetheless, we decided to go out.

definition_en: Something that is usual, typical, or standard.
definition_pt: Algo que é usual, típico ou padrão.
example: This kind of behavior is the norm in their culture.

definition_en: Conforming to a standard; usual, typical, or expected.
definition_pt: Conforme a um padrão; usual, típico ou esperado.
example: Her temperature is back to normal.

definition_en: A conception of or belief about something; an impulse or desire.
definition_pt: Uma concepção ou crença sobre algo; um impulso ou desejo.
example: I have no notion of what you're talking about.

definition_en: In spite of.
definition_pt: Apesar de.
example: Notwithstanding the bad weather, the event was a success.

definition_en: Relating to the nucleus of an atom or the energy released during nuclear fission or fusion.
definition_pt: Relacionado ao núcleo de um átomo ou à energia liberada durante a fissão ou fusão nuclear.
example: The country is developing nuclear power.

definition_en: An act or course of action to which a person is morally or legally bound; a duty or commitment.
definition_pt: Um ato ou curso de ação ao qual uma pessoa está moralmente ou legalmente obrigada; um dever ou compromisso.
example: You have a legal obligation to pay taxes.

definition_en: To get, acquire, or secure something.
definition_pt: Conseguir, adquirir ou assegurar algo.
example: You'll need to obtain a permit first.

definition_en: To reside or have one's place of business in a building; to fill or take up a space or time.
definition_pt: Residir ou ter o local de negócios em um edifício; preencher ou ocupar um espaço ou tempo.
example: The family occupies the apartment on the top floor.

definition_en: Different from what is usual or expected; strange.
definition_pt: Diferente do que é usual ou esperado; estranho.
example: That's an odd thing to say.

definition_en: To counteract something by having an opposing force or effect.
definition_pt: Contrabalançar algo por ter uma força ou efeito oposto.
example: The losses were offset by gains in other areas.

definition_en: Continuing; still in progress.
definition_pt: Continuando; ainda em andamento.
example: There is an ongoing investigation into the matter.

definition_en: A person's basic attitude, beliefs, or feelings; familiarization with something.
definition_pt: A atitude, crenças ou sentimentos básicos de uma pessoa; familiarização com algo.
example: The company provides an orientation program for new employees.

definition_en: The way a thing turns out; a consequence.
definition_pt: A maneira como uma coisa resulta; uma consequência.
example: We are waiting to hear the outcome of the negotiations.

definition_en: The amount of something produced by a person, machine, or industry; the process of producing something.
definition_pt: A quantidade de algo produzido por uma pessoa, máquina ou indústria; o processo de produzir algo.
example: The factory has increased its output this year.

definition_en: Taking everything into account; in general.
definition_pt: Levando tudo em consideração; em geral.
example: The overall situation is improving.

definition_en: To extend over so as to cover partly; a part or amount which overlaps.
definition_pt: Estender-se sobre para cobrir parcialmente; uma parte ou quantidade que se sobrepõe.
example: Our responsibilities overlap in some areas.

definition_en: To supervise a person or work.
definition_pt: Supervisionar uma pessoa ou trabalho.
example: Her job is to oversee the production department.

definition_en: A flat or curved component, typically rectangular, that forms or is set into the surface of a door, wall, or ceiling; a group of experts.
definition_pt: Um componente plano ou curvo, tipicamente retangular, que forma ou é colocado na superfície de uma porta, parede ou teto; um grupo de especialistas.
example: A panel of judges will select the winner.

definition_en: A distinct section of a piece of writing, usually dealing with a single theme.
definition_pt: Uma seção distinta de um texto, geralmente tratando de um único tema.
example: Start a new paragraph here.

definition_en: Side by side and having the same distance continuously between them; similar or analogous.
definition_pt: Lado a lado e tendo a mesma distância continuamente entre eles; similar ou análogo.
example: The road runs parallel to the river.

definition_en: A limit or boundary which defines the scope of a particular process or activity.
definition_pt: Um limite ou fronteira que define o escopo de um processo ou atividade específica.
example: We need to define the parameters of the project.

definition_en: A person who takes part in an undertaking with another or others, especially in a business.
definition_pt: Uma pessoa que participa de um empreendimento com outra ou outras, especialmente em um negócio.
example: He's my business partner.

definition_en: Accepting or allowing what happens or what others do, without active response or resistance.
definition_pt: Aceitar ou permitir o que acontece ou o que os outros fazem, sem resposta ativa ou resistência.
example: He played a passive role in the relationship.

definition_en: By a specified amount in or for every hundred.
definition_pt: Por uma quantia especificada em ou para cada cem.
example: Prices have risen by twenty percent.

definition_en: A length or portion of time.
definition_pt: Um comprimento ou porção de tempo.
example: He lived in Paris for a period of time.

definition_en: Lasting or intended to last or remain unchanged indefinitely.
definition_pt: Durando ou destinado a durar ou permanecer inalterado indefinidamente.
example: The damage may be permanent.

definition_en: To continue firmly or obstinately in an opinion or course of action in spite of difficulty or opposition.
definition_pt: Continuar firme ou obstinadamente em uma opinião ou curso de ação apesar da dificuldade ou oposição.
example: If you persist with this behavior, you will be punished.

definition_en: A particular attitude towards or way of regarding something; a point of view.
definition_pt: Uma atitude particular em relação ou maneira de considerar algo; um ponto de vista.
example: The book offers a fresh perspective on the events.

definition_en: A distinct period or stage in a process of change or development.
definition_pt: Um período ou estágio distinto em um processo de mudança ou desenvolvimento.
example: The project is in its final phase.

definition_en: A fact or situation that is observed to exist or happen, especially one whose cause is in question.
definition_pt: Um fato ou situação que é observado existir ou acontecer, especialmente um cuja causa está em questão.
example: Hurricanes are a natural phenomenon.

definition_en: The study of the fundamental nature of knowledge, reality, and existence; a theory or attitude that acts as a guiding principle.
definition_pt: O estudo da natureza fundamental do conhecimento, realidade e existência; uma teoria ou atitude que age como um princípio orientador.
example: What's your philosophy on raising children?

definition_en: Relating to the body as opposed to the mind; relating to things perceived through the senses.
definition_pt: Relacionado ao corpo em oposição à mente; relacionado a coisas percebidas através dos sentidos.
example: Regular physical exercise is important.

definition_en: With the addition of; a positive factor.
definition_pt: Com a adição de; um fator positivo.
example: Two plus two equals four. / The job has many pluses.

definition_en: A course or principle of action adopted or proposed by an organization or individual.
definition_pt: Um curso ou princípio de ação adotado ou proposto por uma organização ou indivíduo.
example: The company has a strict no-smoking policy.

definition_en: A part of a whole; an amount of food for one person.
definition_pt: Uma parte de um todo; uma quantidade de comida para uma pessoa.
example: He only ate a small portion of his meal.

definition_en: To present or constitute a problem, danger, or difficulty; to assume a particular position.
definition_pt: Apresentar ou constituir um problema, perigo ou dificuldade; assumir uma posição particular.
example: The chemicals pose a threat to the environment.

definition_en: A person actively engaged in an art, discipline, or profession.
definition_pt: Uma pessoa engajada ativamente em uma arte, disciplina ou profissão.
example: She is a medical practitioner.

definition_en: To come before something in time, order, or position.
definition_pt: Vir antes de algo no tempo, ordem ou posição.
example: Lunch will be preceded by a short speech.

definition_en: Marked by exactness and accuracy of expression or detail.
definition_pt: Marcado pela exatidão e precisão de expressão ou detalhe.
example: I need the precise measurements.

definition_en: Present as the strongest or main element.
definition_pt: Presente como o elemento mais forte ou principal.
example: The predominant color in the room is blue.

definition_en: Preceding or done in preparation for something fuller or more important.
definition_pt: Precedendo ou feito em preparação para algo mais completo ou mais importante.
example: The team was eliminated in the preliminary rounds.

definition_en: To suppose that something is the case on the basis of probability.
definition_pt: Supor que algo é o caso com base na probabilidade.
example: I presume you're here for the interview.

definition_en: Of first importance; main.
definition_pt: De primeira importância; principal.
example: His prime objective is to win.

definition_en: First in order of importance; main.
definition_pt: Primeiro em ordem de importância; principal.
example: The principal reason for my decision is cost.

definition_en: A fundamental truth or proposition that serves as the foundation for a system of belief or behavior.
definition_pt: Uma verdade ou proposição fundamental que serve como base para um sistema de crença ou comportamento.
example: It's against my principles to lie.

definition_en: Existing or coming before in time, order, or importance.
definition_pt: Existir ou vir antes no tempo, ordem ou importância.
example: You need prior approval for this.

definition_en: The fact or condition of being regarded or treated as more important than others.
definition_pt: O fato ou condição de ser considerado ou tratado como mais importante que outros.
example: Safety is our top priority.

definition_en: To begin or continue a course of action.
definition_pt: Começar ou continuar um curso de ação.
example: The government decided to proceed with the election.

definition_en: A series of actions or steps taken to achieve a particular end; to perform a series of operations.
definition_pt: Uma série de ações ou etapas tomadas para alcançar um fim específico; realizar uma série de operações.
example: The application process can take several weeks.

definition_en: Relating to or connected with a profession; engaged in a specified activity as one's main paid occupation.
definition_pt: Relacionado ou conectado com uma profissão; engajado em uma atividade específica como ocupação principal remunerada.
example: She is a professional photographer.

definition_en: To formally forbid something by law, rule, or other authority.
definition_pt: Proibir formalmente algo por lei, regra ou outra autoridade.
example: Smoking is prohibited in this building.

definition_en: An individual or collaborative enterprise planned to achieve a particular aim; to estimate or forecast.
definition_pt: Um empreendimento individual ou colaborativo planejado para alcançar um objetivo específico; estimar ou prever.
example: We're working on a new project.

definition_en: To further the progress of something; to advance to a higher position.
definition_pt: Promover o progresso de algo; avançar para uma posição superior.
example: The campaign aims to promote healthy eating.

definition_en: A part, share, or number considered in comparative relation to a whole.
definition_pt: Uma parte, parcela ou número considerado em relação comparativa a um todo.
example: A large proportion of the budget is spent on defense.

definition_en: The possibility or likelihood of some future event occurring; to search for mineral deposits.
definition_pt: A possibilidade ou probabilidade de algum evento futuro ocorrer; procurar por depósitos minerais.
example: The prospect of rain forced us to cancel the picnic.

definition_en: The official procedure or system of rules governing affairs of state or diplomatic occasions.
definition_pt: O procedimento oficial ou sistema de regras que rege assuntos de estado ou ocasiões diplomáticas.
example: According to protocol, the ambassador was greeted first.

definition_en: The scientific study of the human mind and its functions, especially those affecting behavior.
definition_pt: O estudo científico da mente humana e suas funções, especialmente aquelas que afetam o comportamento.
example: She has a degree in psychology.

definition_en: The preparation and issuing of a book, journal, or piece of music for public sale.
definition_pt: A preparação e emissão de um livro, revista ou peça musical para venda pública.
example: The publication of his first novel was a great success.

definition_en: To prepare and issue material for public sale or distribution.
definition_pt: Preparar e emitir material para venda ou distribuição pública.
example: The newspaper published the story on its front page.

definition_en: To follow or chase someone or something; to continue or proceed along a path.
definition_pt: Seguir ou perseguir alguém ou algo; continuar ou proceder ao longo de um caminho.
example: She decided to pursue a career in medicine.

definition_en: Relating to, measuring, or measured by the quality of something rather than its quantity.
definition_pt: Relacionado a, medindo ou medido pela qualidade de algo, em vez de sua quantidade.
example: We need a qualitative analysis of the data.

definition_en: To repeat or copy out words from a text or speech; to state a price for a job or service.
definition_pt: Repetir ou copiar palavras de um texto ou discurso; declarar um preço para um trabalho ou serviço.
example: She quoted a passage from the Bible.

definition_en: Relating to or affecting the fundamental nature of something; advocating thorough political or social reform.
definition_pt: Relacionado ou afetando a natureza fundamental de algo; defendendo uma reforma política ou social completa.
example: We need a radical solution to this problem.

definition_en: Made, done, or happening without method or conscious decision.
definition_pt: Feito, feito ou acontecendo sem método ou decisão consciente.
example: The sample was selected at random.

definition_en: The quantitative relation between two amounts showing the number of times one value contains or is contained within the other.
definition_pt: A relação quantitativa entre dois valores que mostra o número de vezes que um valor contém ou está contido dentro do outro.
example: The ratio of men to women is two to one.

definition_en: Based on or in accordance with reason or logic.
definition_pt: Baseado ou de acordo com a razão ou lógica.
example: There is no rational explanation for his behavior.

definition_en: To return to a normal state of health, mind, or strength; to regain possession of something.
definition_pt: Retornar a um estado normal de saúde, mente ou força; recuperar a posse de algo.
example: It took her weeks to recover from the illness.

definition_en: To throw back heat, light, or sound without absorbing it; to think deeply or carefully about.
definition_pt: Jogar de volta calor, luz ou som sem absorvê-lo; pensar profundamente ou cuidadosamente sobre.
example: The water reflected the sunlight. / I need time to reflect on your proposal.

definition_en: A government, especially an authoritarian one; a system or planned way of doing things.
definition_pt: Um governo, especialmente um autoritário; um sistema ou maneira planejada de fazer coisas.
example: The old regime was overthrown.

definition_en: An area, especially part of a country or the world having definable characteristics but not always fixed boundaries.
definition_pt: Uma área, especialmente parte de um país ou do mundo com características definíveis, mas nem sempre limites fixos.
example: The wine from this region is excellent.

definition_en: To strengthen or support, especially with additional material or people.
definition_pt: Fortalecer ou apoiar, especialmente com material ou pessoas adicionais.
example: The news reinforced my belief that we were right.

definition_en: To dismiss as inadequate, unacceptable, or faulty.
definition_pt: Dispensar como inadequado, inaceitável ou com defeito.
example: The committee rejected the proposal.

definition_en: To make or become less tense or anxious.
definition_pt: Tornar-se ou ficar menos tenso ou ansioso.
example: I like to relax with a good book.

definition_en: To set free from confinement; to allow something to move, act, or flow freely.
definition_pt: Libertar do confinamento; permitir que algo se mova, aja ou flua livremente.
example: The hostages were released. / The band released a new album.

definition_en: Dependence on or trust in someone or something.
definition_pt: Dependência ou confiança em alguém ou algo.
example: Our reliance on technology is increasing.

definition_en: Unwilling and hesitant; disinclined.
definition_pt: Não disposto e hesitante; desinclinado.
example: He was reluctant to commit to the plan.

definition_en: To depend on with full trust or confidence.
definition_pt: Depender com total confiança ou confiança.
example: You can rely on me to keep your secret.

definition_en: The systematic investigation into and study of materials and sources to establish facts and reach new conclusions.
definition_pt: A investigação sistemática e o estudo de materiais e fontes para estabelecer fatos e chegar a novas conclusões.
example: He is conducting research into climate change.

definition_en: To prevent someone or something from doing something; to keep under control.
definition_pt: Impedir alguém ou algo de fazer algo; manter sob controle.
example: He could barely restrain his anger.

definition_en: Income, especially when of a company or organization and of a substantial nature.
definition_pt: Renda, especialmente quando de uma empresa ou organização e de natureza substancial.
example: The company's revenue increased by 15% last year.

definition_en: To move backward; to turn something the opposite way.
definition_pt: Mover para trás; virar algo para o lado oposto.
example: The court reversed its decision.

definition_en: To re-examine and make alterations to written or printed matter.
definition_pt: Reexaminar e fazer alterações em matéria escrita ou impressa.
example: I need to revise this chapter before the exam.

definition_en: A forcible overthrow of a government or social order; a dramatic and wide-reaching change.
definition_pt: Uma derrubada forçada de um governo ou ordem social; uma mudança dramática e abrangente.
example: The industrial revolution changed society completely.

definition_en: Unable to bend or be forced out of shape; not flexible.
definition_pt: Incapaz de dobrar ou ser forçado a sair do formato; não flexível.
example: The rules are too rigid.

definition_en: An actor's part in a play, film, etc.; the function assumed by a person or thing.
definition_pt: A parte de um ator em uma peça, filme, etc.; a função assumida por uma pessoa ou coisa.
example: What is your role in the company?

definition_en: A way or course taken in getting from a starting point to a destination.
definition_pt: Um caminho ou curso tomado para ir de um ponto de partida a um destino.
example: What's the best route to the airport?

definition_en: A postulated sequence or development of events.
definition_pt: Uma sequência ou desenvolvimento postulado de eventos.
example: Let's consider the worst-case scenario.

definition_en: A plan for carrying out a process or procedure, giving lists of intended events and times.
definition_pt: Um plano para realizar um processo ou procedimento, dando listas de eventos e horários pretendidos.
example: What's your schedule for tomorrow?

definition_en: A large-scale systematic plan or arrangement for attaining a particular object; a secret or underhand plan.
definition_pt: Um plano ou arranjo sistemático em larga escala para atingir um objeto específico; um plano secreto ou sorrateiro.
example: The government has introduced a new health insurance scheme.

definition_en: The extent of the area or subject matter that something deals with or to which it is relevant.
definition_pt: A extensão da área ou assunto que algo trata ou para o qual é relevante.
example: This subject is beyond the scope of our investigation.

definition_en: Any of the more or less distinct parts into which something is divided.
definition_pt: Qualquer uma das partes mais ou menos distintas em que algo é dividido.
example: The newspaper has a business section.

definition_en: An area or portion that is distinct from others; a distinct part of the economy.
definition_pt: Uma área ou porção que é distinta das outras; uma parte distinta da economia.
example: She works in the public sector.

definition_en: Fixed or fastened so as not to give way, become loose, or be lost; to obtain something.
definition_pt: Fixo ou preso para não ceder, afrouxar ou ser perdido; obter algo.
example: Make sure the ladder is secure before climbing. / He secured a loan from the bank.

definition_en: A particular order in which related events, movements, or things follow each other.
definition_pt: Uma ordem específica na qual eventos, movimentos ou coisas relacionados se seguem.
example: The sequence of events is unclear.

definition_en: A number of things, events, or people of a similar kind or related nature coming one after another.
definition_pt: Uma série de coisas, eventos ou pessoas de tipo semelhante ou natureza relacionada vindo um após o outro.
example: A series of accidents forced the road to close.

definition_en: Either of the two main categories (male and female) into which humans and most other living things are divided.
definition_pt: Qualquer uma das duas categorias principais (masculino e feminino) nas quais os humanos e a maioria dos outros seres vivos são divididos.
example: Discrimination on the basis of sex is illegal.

definition_en: To move or change from one position, direction, or focus to another.
definition_pt: Mover ou mudar de uma posição, direção ou foco para outro.
example: Public opinion has shifted on this issue.

definition_en: Sufficiently great or important to be worthy of attention; having a particular meaning.
definition_pt: Suficientemente grande ou importante para ser digno de atenção; ter um significado particular.
example: There has been a significant increase in sales.

definition_en: To imitate the appearance or character of something; to create a model of a process.
definition_pt: Imitar a aparência ou caráter de algo; criar um modelo de um processo.
example: The flight simulator can simulate various weather conditions.

definition_en: Used to show that something or someone is commonly designated by the name or term specified.
definition_pt: Usado para mostrar que algo ou alguém é comumente designado pelo nome ou termo especificado.
example: His so-called friends abandoned him when he needed them.

definition_en: Consistently good in quality or performance; trustworthy.
definition_pt: Consistentemente bom em qualidade ou desempenho; confiável.
example: He is a reliable friend.

definition_en: A departure from what is normal, usual, or expected, typically an unwelcome one.
definition_pt: Um desvio do que é normal, usual ou esperado, normalmente um indesejado.
example: The political party considered the defeat to be a temporary aberration.

definition_en: To restrain oneself from doing or enjoying something; to formally decline to vote.
definition_pt: Conter-se de fazer ou desfrutar de algo; recusar-se formalmente a votar.
example: Several countries chose to abstain from the UN resolution.

definition_en: To accept something reluctantly but without protest.
definition_pt: Aceitar algo relutantemente, mas sem protestar.
example: With a sigh, he acquiesced to their demands.

definition_en: To render something poorer in quality by adding another substance.
definition_pt: Tornar algo de qualidade inferior ao adicionar outra substância.
example: The food was found to be adulterated with harmful chemicals.

definition_en: Concerned with beauty or the appreciation of beauty.
definition_pt: Relacionado à beleza ou à apreciação da beleza.
example: The design was driven by aesthetic considerations rather than practicality.

definition_en: Having a great deal of money; wealthy.
definition_pt: Que tem muito dinheiro; rico.
example: The school is located in an affluent suburb.

definition_en: A whole formed by combining several separate elements; to form or group into a class or cluster.
definition_pt: Um todo formado pela combinação de vários elementos separados; formar ou agrupar em uma classe ou cluster.
example: The aggregate of all our knowledge is still insufficient to solve the problem.

definition_en: To cause someone to feel isolated or estranged; to transfer ownership of property.
definition_pt: Fazer com que alguém se sinta isolado ou estranhado; transferir a propriedade de um bem.
example: His controversial opinions alienated many of his supporters.

definition_en: To make suffering, deficiency, or a problem less severe.
definition_pt: Tornar o sofrimento, a deficiência ou um problema menos severo.
example: The medication helps to alleviate the symptoms.

definition_en: To combine or unite to form one organization or structure.
definition_pt: Combinar ou unir para formar uma organização ou estrutura.
example: The two companies amalgamated to form a single corporation.

definition_en: Open to more than one interpretation; not clear or decided.
definition_pt: Aberto a mais de uma interpretação; não claro ou decidido.
example: His answer was deliberately ambiguous.

definition_en: Having mixed feelings or contradictory ideas about something or someone.
definition_pt: Ter sentimentos conflitantes ou ideias contraditórias sobre algo ou alguém.
example: She felt ambivalent about accepting the job offer.

definition_en: To make something bad or unsatisfactory better.
definition_pt: Tornar algo ruim ou insatisfatório melhor.
example: Steps have been taken to ameliorate the situation.

definition_en: Something or someone that is not in its correct historical or chronological time.
definition_pt: Algo ou alguém que não está em seu tempo histórico ou cronológico correto.
example: The film was full of anachronisms, like a watch in a medieval scene.

definition_en: Comparable in certain respects, typically in a way that makes clearer the nature of the things compared.
definition_pt: Comparável em certos aspectos, normalmente de uma forma que torna mais clara a natureza das coisas comparadas.
example: The situation is analogous to one we faced last year.

definition_en: A state of disorder due to absence or non-recognition of authority.
definition_pt: Um estado de desordem devido à ausência ou não reconhecimento de autoridade.
example: The overthrow of the government was followed by a period of anarchy.

definition_en: Something that deviates from what is standard, normal, or expected.
definition_pt: Algo que se desvia do que é padrão, normal ou esperado.
example: The scientist could not explain the anomaly in the data.

definition_en: To cause someone to become hostile.
definition_pt: Fazer com que alguém se torne hostil.
example: He didn't want to antagonize his already angry boss.

definition_en: A deep-seated feeling of dislike; aversion.
definition_pt: Um sentimento profundamente enraizado de desgosto; aversão.
example: She felt a strong antipathy towards the proposed policy.

definition_en: Lack of interest, enthusiasm, or concern.
definition_pt: Falta de interesse, entusiasmo ou preocupação.
example: Voter apathy is a serious problem in many democracies.

definition_en: To reach an authoritative judgment or settlement.
definition_pt: Chegar a um julgamento ou acordo autoritativo.
example: An independent committee was appointed to arbitrate the dispute.

definition_en: Understood by few; mysterious or secret.
definition_pt: Compreendido por poucos; misterioso ou secreto.
example: The professor had an extensive knowledge of arcane philosophical texts.

definition_en: Very old or old-fashioned.
definition_pt: Muito antigo ou antiquado.
example: The law is archaic and needs to be reformed.

definition_en: Involving or requiring strenuous effort; difficult and tiring.
definition_pt: Envolver ou exigir esforço intenso; difícil e cansativo.
example: The climb was long and arduous.

definition_en: Showing great care and perseverance.
definition_pt: Mostrar grande cuidado e perseverança.
example: She was assiduous in her research, leaving no stone unturned.

definition_en: To make an unpleasant feeling less intense; to satisfy an appetite or desire.
definition_pt: Tornar um sentimento desagradável menos intenso; satisfazer um apetite ou desejo.
example: The government tried to assuage public fears about the epidemic.

definition_en: Having or showing an ability to accurately assess situations or people and turn this to one's advantage.
definition_pt: Ter ou mostrar uma capacidade de avaliar com precisão situações ou pessoas e transformar isso em vantagem.
example: An astute investor, he sold his shares just before the market crashed.

definition_en: The protection granted by a state to someone who has left their home country as a political refugee.
definition_pt: A proteção concedida por um estado a alguém que deixou seu país de origem como refugiado político.
example: He sought asylum after being persecuted for his political beliefs.

definition_en: Severe or strict in manner or appearance; having no comforts or luxuries.
definition_pt: Severo ou rigoroso no modo ou aparência; não ter confortos ou luxos.
example: The monk lived an austere life in a small cell.

definition_en: Having the freedom to govern itself or control its own affairs.
definition_pt: Ter a liberdade de governar a si mesmo ou controlar seus próprios assuntos.
example: The university is an autonomous institution.

definition_en: Hostile and aggressive.
definition_pt: Hostil e agressivo.
example: The drunk man became belligerent and started a fight.

definition_en: Well meaning and kindly.
definition_pt: Bem-intencionado e bondoso.
example: He was a benevolent dictator, loved by his people for his generous policies.

definition_en: To support or strengthen; to prop up.
definition_pt: Apoiar ou fortalecer; escorar.
example: The new evidence bolstered her case.

definition_en: A harsh, discordant mixture of sounds.
definition_pt: Uma mistura áspera e discordante de sons.
example: A cacophony of car horns filled the city street.

definition_en: Truthful and straightforward; frank.
definition_pt: Verdadeiro e direto; franco.
example: I would like your candid opinion on my proposal.

definition_en: Given to sudden and unaccountable changes of mood or behavior.
definition_pt: Dado a mudanças súbitas e inexplicáveis de humor ou comportamento.
example: The weather here is notoriously capricious.

definition_en: A person or thing that precipitates an event or change.
definition_pt: Uma pessoa ou coisa que precipita um evento ou mudança.
example: Her speech acted as a catalyst for reform.

definition_en: Including a wide variety of things; all-embracing. (Also: relating to the Roman Catholic Church).
definition_pt: Incluindo uma grande variedade de coisas; abrangente. (Também: relativo à Igreja Católica Romana).
example: He has catholic tastes in music, enjoying everything from opera to hip-hop.

definition_en: Able to burn or corrode organic tissue by chemical action; sarcastic in a scathing and bitter way.
definition_pt: Capaz de queimar ou corroer tecido orgânico por ação química; sarcástico de uma forma mordaz e amarga.
example: She was known for her caustic wit.

definition_en: To express severe disapproval of someone or something, typically in a formal statement.
definition_pt: Expressar forte desaprovação de alguém ou algo, normalmente em uma declaração formal.
example: The committee voted to censure the senator for his conduct.

definition_en: The use of trickery to achieve a political, financial, or legal purpose.
definition_pt: O uso de truques para alcançar um propósito político, financeiro ou legal.
example: The election was marred by allegations of chicanery.

definition_en: Clear, logical, and convincing.
definition_pt: Claro, lógico e convincente.
example: She presented a cogent argument for the defense.

definition_en: Extremely complex and difficult to follow.
definition_pt: Extremamente complexo e difícil de acompanhar.
example: His explanation was so convoluted that nobody understood it.

definition_en: To confirm or give support to a statement, theory, or finding.
definition_pt: Confirmar ou dar suporte a uma declaração, teoria ou descoberta.
example: The new evidence corroborates the witness's testimony.

definition_en: Having or showing too great a readiness to believe things; gullible.
definition_pt: Ter ou mostrar uma prontidão excessiva para acreditar nas coisas; ingênuo.
example: The scam targeted credulous elderly people.

definition_en: Deserving blame; guilty.
definition_pt: Merecedor de culpa; culpado.
example: The judge found him culpable of negligence.

definition_en: A scarcity or lack of something.
definition_pt: Uma escassez ou falta de algo.
example: There is a dearth of reliable information on the subject.

definition_en: To make someone weak and infirm.
definition_pt: Tornar alguém fraco e enfermo.
example: The disease debilitates the body's immune system.

definition_en: To publicly denounce.
definition_pt: Denunciar publicamente.
example: He decried the government's inaction on climate change.

definition_en: Humble submission and respect.
definition_pt: Submissão humilde e respeito.
example: He treated his elders with deference.

definition_en: To describe or portray something precisely.
definition_pt: Descrever ou retratar algo com precisão.
example: The report clearly delineates the steps that need to be taken.

definition_en: A political leader who seeks support by appealing to popular desires and prejudices rather than by using rational argument.
definition_pt: Um líder político que busca apoio apelando para desejos e preconceitos populares em vez de usar argumentos racionais.
example: He was accused of being a demagogue who exploited people's fears.

definition_en: To express contempt for; to ridicule.
definition_pt: Expressar desprezo por; ridicularizar.
example: Critics derided the proposal as unworkable.

definition_en: To remove the moisture from something; to cause to become completely dry.
definition_pt: Remover a umidade de algo; causar para se tornar completamente seco.
example: The intense heat desiccated the landscape.

definition_en: Lacking a plan, purpose, or enthusiasm; occurring randomly.
definition_pt: Faltando um plano, propósito ou entusiasmo; ocorrendo aleatoriamente.
example: They made a desultory attempt to clean the room before giving up.

definition_en: A forceful and bitter verbal attack against someone or something.
definition_pt: Um ataque verbal forte e amargo contra alguém ou algo.
example: He launched into a long diatribe against the management.

definition_en: Intended to teach, particularly in having moral instruction as an ulterior motive.
definition_pt: Com a intenção de ensinar, particularmente por ter instrução moral como um motivo ulterior.
example: The novel's didactic tone made it feel more like a lecture than a story.

definition_en: Modest or shy because of a lack of self-confidence.
definition_pt: Modesto ou tímido devido a uma falta de autoconfiança.
example: She was diffident about expressing her opinions in meetings.

definition_en: Slow to act; intended to cause delay.
definition_pt: Lento para agir; com a intenção de causar atraso.
example: The company used dilatory tactics to postpone the lawsuit.

definition_en: A person who cultivates an area of interest, such as the arts, without real commitment or knowledge.
definition_pt: Uma pessoa que cultiva uma área de interesse, como as artes, sem compromisso ou conhecimento real.
example: He was a dilettante in philosophy, having read a few books but lacking deep understanding.

definition_en: To represent as being of little worth; to belittle.
definition_pt: Representar como sendo de pouco valor; menosprezar.
example: He never missed an opportunity to disparage his competitors.

definition_en: Essentially different in kind; not allowing comparison.
definition_pt: Essencialmente diferente em tipo; não permitindo comparação.
example: They tried to combine these disparate elements into a single policy.

definition_en: To spread or disperse something, especially information, widely.
definition_pt: Espalhar ou dispersar algo, especialmente informação, amplamente.
example: The organization's goal is to disseminate knowledge about human rights.

definition_en: To disperse or scatter; to squander or fritter away money, energy, or resources.
definition_pt: Dispersar ou espalhar; esbanjar ou desperdiçar dinheiro, energia ou recursos.
example: The morning fog gradually dissipated. / He dissipated his inheritance on gambling.

definition_en: A lack of harmony among musical notes; a tension or clash resulting from the combination of two disharmonious elements.
definition_pt: Uma falta de harmonia entre notas musicais; uma tensão ou conflito resultante da combinação de dois elementos desarmônicos.
example: There is a cognitive dissonance between his professed beliefs and his actions.

definition_en: Outstandingly bad; shocking.
definition_pt: Extraordinariamente ruim; chocante.
example: It was an egregious error that cost the company millions.

definition_en: To evoke or draw out a response, answer, or fact from someone.
definition_pt: Evocar ou extrair uma resposta, resposta ou fato de alguém.
example: The interviewer tried to elicit more details about the incident.

definition_en: To make something more attractive by the addition of decorative details or features; to make a story more interesting by adding fictitious details.
definition_pt: Tornar algo mais atraente pela adição de detalhes ou características decorativas; tornar uma história mais interessante adicionando detalhes fictícios.
example: He tends to embellish his stories to make them more entertaining.

definition_en: To cause someone to feel drained of energy or vitality; to weaken.
definition_pt: Fazer com que alguém se sinta drenado de energia ou vitalidade; enfraquecer.
example: The humid climate enervated the explorers.

definition_en: To cause or give rise to a feeling, situation, or condition.
definition_pt: Causar ou dar origem a um sentimento, situação ou condição.
example: His speech engendered a sense of hope among the people.

definition_en: A person or thing that is mysterious, puzzling, or difficult to understand.
definition_pt: Uma pessoa ou coisa que é misteriosa, intrigante ou difícil de entender.
example: The real purpose of the ancient structure remains an enigma.

definition_en: Lasting for a very short time.
definition_pt: Durando por um tempo muito curto.
example: Fame is often ephemeral.

definition_en: To use ambiguous language so as to conceal the truth or avoid committing oneself.
definition_pt: Usar linguagem ambígua para ocultar a verdade ou evitar comprometer-se.
example: Politicians often equivocate when asked difficult questions.

definition_en: Having or showing great knowledge or learning.
definition_pt: Ter ou mostrar grande conhecimento ou aprendizado.
example: The professor was erudite and could speak on a vast array of topics.

definition_en: Intended for or likely to be understood by only a small number of people with a specialized knowledge or interest.
definition_pt: Destinado ou provavelmente ser entendido apenas por um pequeno número de pessoas com conhecimento ou interesse especializado.
example: The discussion was full of esoteric references to ancient texts.

definition_en: A speech or piece of writing that praises someone or something highly, typically someone who has just died.
definition_pt: Um discurso ou texto que elogia muito alguém ou algo, normalmente alguém que acabou de morrer.
example: He delivered a moving eulogy at his father's funeral.

definition_en: A mild or indirect word or expression substituted for one considered to be too harsh or blunt.
definition_pt: Uma palavra ou expressão suave ou indireta substituída por uma considerada muito dura ou direta.
example: 'Passed away' is a euphemism for 'died'.

definition_en: To make a problem, bad situation, or negative feeling worse.
definition_pt: Tornar um problema, uma situação ruim ou um sentimento negativo pior.
example: His comments only exacerbated the tension in the room.

definition_en: To show or declare that someone is not guilty of wrongdoing.
definition_pt: Mostrar ou declarar que alguém não é culpado de irregularidades.
example: The new evidence exculpated the defendant.

definition_en: Pressing; demanding.
definition_pt: Premente; demandante.
example: These exigent circumstances require immediate action.

definition_en: Irrelevant or unrelated to the subject being dealt with.
definition_pt: Irrelevante ou não relacionado ao assunto que está sendo tratado.
example: Please avoid including extraneous details in your report.

definition_en: Very attentive to and concerned about accuracy and detail; very concerned about cleanliness.
definition_pt: Muito atento e preocupado com precisão e detalhes; muito preocupado com a limpeza.
example: He was fastidious about his appearance.

definition_en: Silly and pointless.
definition_pt: Bobo e inútil.
example: She made some fatuous comment about the situation.

definition_en: Producing or capable of producing an abundance of offspring or new growth; highly fertile.
definition_pt: Produzir ou capaz de produzir uma abundância de descendentes ou novo crescimento; altamente fértil.
example: He had a fecund imagination, always coming up with new ideas.

definition_en: Having or displaying a passionate intensity.
definition_pt: Ter ou exibir uma intensidade passionada.
example: She is a fervent believer in social justice.

definition_en: Excessively talkative, especially on trivial matters.
definition_pt: Excessivamente tagarela, especialmente em assuntos triviais.
example: The garrulous old man told stories for hours.

definition_en: Fond of company; sociable.
definition_pt: Afeiçoado à companhia; sociável.
example: She was outgoing and gregarious, always the life of the party.

definition_en: A lengthy and aggressive speech.
definition_pt: Um discurso longo e agressivo.
example: The coach delivered a halftime harangue to motivate the team.

definition_en: A person who believes that the pursuit of pleasure is the most important thing in life.
definition_pt: Uma pessoa que acredita que a busca pelo prazer é a coisa mais importante na vida.
example: He lived his life as a hedonist, seeking pleasure above all else.

definition_en: A mode of behavior or way of thought peculiar to an individual.
definition_pt: Um modo de comportamento ou maneira de pensar peculiar a um indivíduo.
example: One of his idiosyncrasies was that he always had to have his coffee in a specific mug.

definition_en: Acting or done quickly and without thought or care.
definition_pt: Agir ou feito rapidamente e sem pensar ou cuidado.
example: She regretted her impetuous decision to quit her job.

definition_en: In an initial stage; beginning to happen or develop.
definition_pt: Em um estágio inicial; começando a acontecer ou se desenvolver.
example: They treated the incipient disease before it could spread.

definition_en: Complete and including all or nearly all elements or aspects of something.
definition_pt: Completo e incluindo todos ou quase todos os elementos ou aspectos de algo.
example: The report was comprehensive and detailed.

definition_en: Showing great attention to detail; very careful and precise.
definition_pt: Que mostra grande atenção aos detalhes; muito cuidadoso e preciso.
example: The artist was meticulous in her work.

definition_en: Present, appearing, or found everywhere.
definition_pt: Presente, aparecendo ou encontrado em todos os lugares.
example: Mobile phones have become ubiquitous in modern society.

definition_en: Having a harmful effect, especially in a gradual or subtle way.
definition_pt: Que tem um efeito prejudicial, especialmente de forma gradual ou sutil.
example: The pernicious influence of social media on self-esteem is well-documented.

definition_en: Having an obstinately uncooperative attitude toward authority or discipline.
definition_pt: Que tem uma atitude obstinadamente não cooperativa em relação à autoridade ou disciplina.
example: The recalcitrant student refused to follow the school's dress code.

definition_en: Designed to impress or attract notice; characterized by vulgar or pretentious display.
definition_pt: Projetado para impressionar ou chamar a atenção; caracterizado por exibição vulgar ou pretensiosa.
example: Their ostentatious mansion was filled with gold-plated furniture.

definition_en: A person who acts obsequiously toward someone important in order to gain advantage.
definition_pt: Pessoa que age de maneira obsequiosa em relação a alguém importante para obter vantagem.
example: The CEO was surrounded by sycophants who never challenged his ideas.

definition_en: To deliberately make something unclear or difficult to understand.
definition_pt: Tornar algo deliberadamente pouco claro ou difícil de entender.
example: Politicians often obfuscate the truth with complicated jargon.

definition_en: Representing the most perfect or typical example of a quality or class.
definition_pt: Que representa o exemplo mais perfeito ou típico de uma qualidade ou classe.
example: He was the quintessential English gentleman, complete with bowler hat and umbrella.

definition_en: Looking or sounding sad and dismal.
definition_pt: Com aparência ou som triste e lúgubre.
example: The lugubrious music matched the somber mood of the funeral.

definition_en: Occurring or discovered by chance in a happy or beneficial way.
definition_pt: Que ocorre ou é descoberto por acaso de forma feliz ou benéfica.
example: Their meeting was serendipitous and led to a lifelong friendship.

definition_en: A person who attacks or criticizes cherished beliefs or institutions.
definition_pt: Pessoa que ataca ou critica crenças ou instituições consagradas.
example: The scientist was considered an iconoclast for challenging established theories.

definition_en: Having or showing keen mental discernment and good judgment.
definition_pt: Que tem ou mostra discernimento mental aguçado e bom julgamento.
example: The sagacious investor predicted the market crash months in advance.

definition_en: Dealing with things sensibly and realistically.
definition_pt: Que lida com as coisas de forma sensível e realista.
example: We need a pragmatic approach to solve this complex problem.

definition_en: Wanting or devouring great quantities of something.
definition_pt: Que deseja ou devora grandes quantidades de algo.
example: She was a voracious reader, finishing several books each week.

definition_en: The fact of appearing everywhere or of being very common.
definition_pt: O fato de aparecer em todos os lugares ou de ser muito comum.
example: The ubiquity of smartphones has changed how we communicate.

definition_en: Generous or forgiving, especially toward a rival or less powerful person.
definition_pt: Generoso ou indulgente, especialmente em relação a um rival ou pessoa menos poderosa.
example: The magnanimous winner praised his opponent's skills.

definition_en: The action of making something obscure, unclear, or unintelligible.
definition_pt: A ação de tornar algo obscuro, pouco claro ou ininteligível.
example: The contract was full of legal obfuscation designed to confuse consumers.

definition_en: Extremely idealistic; unrealistic and impractical.
definition_pt: Extremamente idealista; irrealista e impraticável.
example: His quixotic attempt to reform the political system single-handedly was doomed to fail.

definition_en: Unclear, vague, or ill-defined.
definition_pt: Pouco claro, vago ou mal definido.
example: The company's future plans remained nebulous and uncertain.

definition_en: Stated or appearing to be true, but not necessarily so.
definition_pt: Declarado ou aparentemente verdadeiro, mas não necessariamente.
example: Her ostensible reason for visiting was to discuss business, but she really wanted to see him.

definition_en: Unwilling to spend money or use resources; stingy.
definition_pt: Relutante em gastar dinheiro ou usar recursos; avarento.
example: The parsimonious landlord refused to fix the heating system.

definition_en: Complaining in a petulant or whining manner.
definition_pt: Que reclama de maneira petulante ou chorosa.
example: The tired child became querulous and refused to eat his dinner.

definition_en: Lying down; reclining.
definition_pt: Deitado; reclinado.
example: The recumbent figure on the couch didn't stir when we entered.

definition_en: The quality of being sagacious; keen mental discernment.
definition_pt: A qualidade de ser sagaz; discernimento mental aguçado.
example: The elder's sagacity was respected by the entire community.

definition_en: Eager or quick to argue or fight; aggressively defiant.
definition_pt: Ansioso ou rápido para discutir ou lutar; desafiador agressivo.
example: The truculent teenager challenged every rule his parents set.

definition_en: The state or capacity of being everywhere, especially at the same time.
definition_pt: O estado ou capacidade de estar em todos os lugares, especialmente ao mesmo tempo.
example: The ubiquitousness of social media has transformed modern communication.

definition_en: A change of circumstances or fortune, typically one that is unwelcome or unpleasant.
definition_pt: Uma mudança de circunstâncias ou fortuna, tipicamente indesejada ou desagradável.
example: The vicissitudes of life had made him wary of trusting people too easily.

definition_en: A confused multitude of things.
definition_pt: Uma multidão confusa de coisas.
example: The office was a welter of papers and files after the storm.

definition_en: Relating to hospitality between host and guest.
definition_pt: Relativo à hospitalidade entre anfitrião e convidado.
example: The xenial traditions of the village included elaborate welcoming ceremonies.

definition_en: To join together; to link or unite.
definition_pt: Juntar-se; vincular ou unir.
example: The two countries were yoked together by the trade agreement.

definition_en: The defining spirit or mood of a particular period of history.
definition_pt: O espírito ou clima definidor de um período particular da história.
example: The novel perfectly captured the zeitgeist of the 1920s.

example: I'm happy because it's my birthday.

definition_en: Used to introduce a condition.
definition_pt: Usado para introduzir uma condição.
example: I will come if I have time.

definition_en: Used to emphasize an adjective or adverb.
definition_pt: Usado para enfatizar um adjetivo ou advérbio.
example: She is very intelligent.

definition_en: Also; to a higher degree than is desirable.
definition_pt: Também; em um grau maior do que o desejável.
example: I like coffee too. / It's too hot.

definition_en: Therefore; to such a great extent.
definition_pt: Portanto; em tal extensão.
example: It was raining, so we stayed home. / She is so kind.

definition_en: The early part of the day, from sunrise to noon.
definition_pt: A parte inicial do dia, do nascer do sol ao meio-dia.
example: I drink coffee in the morning.

definition_en: The part of the day between noon and evening.
definition_pt: A parte do dia entre o meio-dia e a noite.
example: I have a meeting in the afternoon.

definition_en: The period of time at the end of the day, usually from about 6 p.m. to bedtime.
definition_pt: O período de tempo no final do dia, geralmente das 18h à hora de dormir.
example: I watch TV in the evening.

definition_en: The period of darkness between sunset and sunrise.
definition_pt: O período de escuridão entre o pôr do sol e o nascer do sol.
example: I sleep at night.

definition_en: A period of 24 hours.
definition_pt: Um período de 24 horas.
example: There are seven days in a week.

definition_en: A period of seven days.
definition_pt: Um período de sete dias.
example: I work five days a week.

definition_en: A period of about four weeks.
definition_pt: Um período de cerca de quatro semanas.
example: January is the first month of the year.

definition_en: A period of 365 or 366 days.
definition_pt: Um período de 365 ou 366 dias.
example: I was born in the year 1990.

definition_en: The indefinite continued progress of existence; a point of time as measured in hours and minutes.
definition_pt: O progresso contínuo indefinido da existência; um ponto no tempo medido em horas e minutos.
example: What time is it? / I don't have time now.

definition_en: A period of 60 minutes.
definition_pt: Um período de 60 minutos.
example: The movie is two hours long.

definition_en: A period of 60 seconds.
definition_pt: Um período de 60 segundos.
example: I'll be ready in five minutes.

definition_en: A period of 1/60 of a minute.
definition_pt: Um período de 1/60 de um minuto.
example: Wait a second, please.

definition_en: The second day of the week.
definition_pt: O segundo dia da semana.
example: I have English class on Monday.

definition_en: The third day of the week.
definition_pt: O terceiro dia da semana.
example: We have a meeting on Tuesday.

definition_en: The fourth day of the week.
definition_pt: O quarto dia da semana.
example: Wednesday is the middle of the week.

definition_en: The fifth day of the week.
definition_pt: O quinto dia da semana.
example: I go to the gym on Thursday.

definition_en: The sixth day of the week.
definition_pt: O sexto dia da semana.
example: Friday is my favorite day.

definition_en: The seventh day of the week.
definition_pt: O sétimo dia da semana.
example: I don't work on Saturday.

definition_en: The first day of the week.
definition_pt: O primeiro dia da semana.
example: I relax on Sunday.

definition_en: The first month of the year.
definition_pt: O primeiro mês do ano.
example: My birthday is in January.

definition_en: The second month of the year.
definition_pt: O segundo mês do ano.
example: February is the shortest month.

definition_en: The third month of the year.
definition_pt: O terceiro mês do ano.
example: Spring begins in March.

definition_en: The fourth month of the year.
definition_pt: O quarto mês do ano.
example: It often rains in April.

definition_en: The fifth month of the year.
definition_pt: O quinto mês do ano.
example: Flowers bloom in May.

definition_en: The sixth month of the year.
definition_pt: O sexto mês do ano.
example: Summer begins in June.

definition_en: The seventh month of the year.
definition_pt: O sétimo mês do ano.
example: July is usually hot.

definition_en: The eighth month of the year.
definition_pt: O oitavo mês do ano.
example: Many people take vacation in August.

definition_en: The ninth month of the year.
definition_pt: O nono mês do ano.
example: School starts in September.

definition_en: The tenth month of the year.
definition_pt: O décimo mês do ano.
example: Halloween is in October.

definition_en: The eleventh month of the year.
definition_pt: O décimo primeiro mês do ano.
example: Thanksgiving is in November.

definition_en: The twelfth month of the year.
definition_pt: O décimo segundo mês do ano.
example: Christmas is in December.

definition_en: The season between winter and summer.
definition_pt: A estação entre o inverno e o verão.
example: Flowers bloom in spring.

definition_en: The warmest season of the year.
definition_pt: A estação mais quente do ano.
example: I go to the beach in summer.

definition_en: The season between summer and winter.
definition_pt: A estação entre o verão e o inverno.
example: Leaves change color in autumn.

definition_en: The coldest season of the year.
definition_pt: A estação mais fria do ano.
example: It snows in winter.

definition_en: At all times; on every occasion.
definition_pt: Em todos os momentos; em todas as ocasiões.
example: I always brush my teeth before bed.

definition_en: Under normal conditions; generally.
definition_pt: Sob condições normais; geralmente.
example: I usually have coffee for breakfast.

definition_en: Frequently; many times.
definition_pt: Com frequência; muitas vezes.
example: I often go to the park.

definition_en: Occasionally; from time to time.
definition_pt: Ocasionalmente; de vez em quando.
example: I sometimes eat pizza for dinner.

definition_en: At no time; not ever.
definition_pt: Em nenhum momento; jamais.
example: I never drink coffee at night.

definition_en: In a good or satisfactory way.
definition_pt: De uma maneira boa ou satisfatória.
example: She speaks English well.

definition_en: In a poor or unsatisfactory way.
definition_pt: De uma maneira pobre ou insatisfatória.
example: He sings badly.

definition_en: At a fast speed; rapidly.
definition_pt: Em uma velocidade rápida; rapidamente.
example: She walks quickly.

definition_en: At a slow speed; not quickly.
definition_pt: Em uma velocidade lenta; não rapidamente.
example: Please speak slowly.

definition_en: With a lot of volume; making much noise.
definition_pt: Com muito volume; fazendo muito barulho.
example: The children were talking loudly.

definition_en: Making little or no noise.
definition_pt: Fazendo pouco ou nenhum barulho.
example: Please close the door quietly.

definition_en: With each other; in proximity or association.
definition_pt: Um com o outro; em proximidade ou associação.
example: We work together.

definition_en: Without any other people; on one's own.
definition_pt: Sem outras pessoas; por conta própria.
example: I live alone.

definition_en: One more time; once more.
definition_pt: Mais uma vez; novamente.
example: Please say that again.

definition_en: No one or nothing more besides; solely.
definition_pt: Ninguém ou nada mais além; exclusivamente.
example: I have only one brother.

definition_en: Simply; only; a very short time ago.
definition_pt: Simplesmente; apenas; há muito pouco tempo.
example: I just arrived. / I have just one cookie.

definition_en: In actual fact; truly.
definition_pt: Na verdade; verdadeiramente.
example: I really like chocolate.

definition_en: Very nearly; not quite.
definition_pt: Muito perto; não completamente.
example: I almost finished my homework.

definition_en: As much or as many as required.
definition_pt: Tanto ou tantos quanto necessário.
example: I have enough money.
